http.server.message

Class HttpMessageHeader

  • java.lang.Object
    • http.server.message.HttpMessageHeader

  • public class HttpMessageHeader
extends java.lang.Object
    The class represents the header section of an HTTP message (request and response)
    Author:
    Lo√Øc DUBOIS-TERMOZ, Alexandre DUFOUR

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpMessageHeader

        public HttpMessageHeader(HttpMessageType httpMessageType)
        The constructor of an HttpMessageHeader instance
        Parameters:
        httpMessageType - the type of the message (REQUEST or RESPONSE)

      • HttpMessageHeader

        public HttpMessageHeader(java.util.List<java.lang.String> fieldsLines,
                         HttpMessageType httpMessageType)
                  throws HttpBadRequestException
        The constructor of an HttpMessageHeader instance. The fields lines specified in parameters are check before added in the object and if the format is not the one expected an exception is raises
        Parameters:
        fieldsLines - the fields lines where each field line must have the format (.*): (.*) to be valid
        httpMessageType - the HTTP message type (RESPONSE or REQUEST) associated with this header
        Throws:
        HttpBadRequestException - if the field is invalid (wrong format or unknown field)

      • getField

        public java.lang.String getField(java.lang.String keyField)
        Searches and returns the field value associated with the specified key
        Parameters:
        keyField - the key of the targeted field value
        Returns:
        the field value of the specified key if exists

      • getFieldLine

        public java.lang.String getFieldLine(java.lang.String keyField)
        Forms and returns the field line from the specified key field
        Parameters:
        keyField - the key field used to gets the field and form it
        Returns:
        the field line corresponding to the specified key field

      • addField

        public void addField(java.lang.String key,
                     java.lang.String value)
              throws HttpBadRequestException
        Adds the field (key + value) to this header if it's a valid field header
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the field to add to this header
        value - the value of the field to add to this header
        Throws:
        HttpBadRequestException - if the field key is unknown for the server

      • addField

        public void addField(HttpMessageField httpMessageField,
                     java.lang.String value)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Adds the field (key + value) to this header if the specified HTTP message field enum instance isn't wrong
        Parameters:
        httpMessageField - the HTTP message field to add to this header if has the good instance
        value - the value of the field to add to this header
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the HTTP message field enum instance is wrong
